newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia regulator allows Trans Capital balloting.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia regulator allows Trans Capital balloting.

text.p: Malaysia's Securities Commission (SC) said on Wednesday it had informed shares issuing house MIDFCCS to proceed with the balloting of Trans Capital Holdings Bhd, a firm to be listed on the local bourse.
The SC had said on Tuesday that it had postponed indefinitely the balloting of shares in Trans Capital and another company, Fumakilla (Malaysia) Bhd, until further notice.
It said the postponements had been ordered for differing reasons but did not give details.
In Wednesday's statement, the SC did not mention the fate of Fumakilla, but said the Trans Capital balloting could proceed as it had found no "basis for further investigation".
The New Straits Times newspaper reported on Wednesday that police were investigating possibilities of malpractice in procedures involving Fumakilla's balloting.
Fumakilla makes household insecticides, while Trans Capital is a manufacturer of electronic components.
